items.content:
Backend Engineer (Data Science Team) at Goldstar

Company: Goldstar
Headquarters: Portland, OR

Goldstar.com is looking for an experienced developer to join our existing team and help grow our data science team and our machine learning/deep learning capabilities. This position is located in Portland, OR.

Goldstar is an industry leading primary ticket sales marketplace that is dedicated to making live entertainment more accessible. We work directly with thousands of theaters, comedians, musicians, magicians, food festivals and all kinds of live entertainment to connect folks that want to go out with interesting things they may not even know exist. Besides our apps and website, we power a number of other large “name brand” marketplaces. We are an established, profitable company that is still growing rapidly. And unlike many companies in the ticketing industry, we are laser-focused on improving the experience of the event goer.

We have a small and nimble data science team that works directly with the rest of our ~40 person team and we’re looking to bring in someone to help create a world class experience for our millions of members. Our technical capabilities for delivering game changing ML solutions is young and we are looking for an experienced engineer that can help us grow our capabilities and drive use of cutting edge technologies like Tensorflow and PyTorch.

You will have significant influence on the architecture and technical decisions of the projects you work on. You’ll work collaboratively with the rest of the company to build a world class user experience. You’ll be helping millions of people go out more and experience their community and you’ll be helping out thousands of theaters, musicians, and comedians by building their audience.

We're looking for professional and experienced Rails developers that can ship code on a daily basis. We have no time or patience for "Rockstars" or brogrammers. We actively encourage diversity on our team and overall company. We have offices in Pasadena, CA and Portland, OR. We're excited to help relocate the right people within the US, but we’re not really into telecommuters/remote right now, although there are always exceptions. We're looking for people that know how to ship great applications.

Apply for this position

Submit an application at https://goldstar.workable.com/j/8616FC5C47

items.title: Senior Data Scientist (marketing analytics) at FindHotel
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=40, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Data Scientist (marketing analytics)

Amsterdam, Netherlands
Company: FindHotel
Job Type: Full-time

Do you want to join us on a journey to change the trillion dollar travel industry? We are looking for the best and brightest who share our passion for data-driven user experience.

FindHotel believes travel is the one thing that really opens minds to new ideas, cultures, and ways of thinking. Our mission is to get every traveler in the world the best accommodation deal. From adventure travel and backpacking to honeymoons and family vacations, we deeply care so that every traveler can make the best-informed accommodation choice at the absolute best conditions for every trip.

To further this goal we need to effectively market best deals across the globe and are looking for analysts to push our marketing efforts to new levels. As a data analyst / scientist you will optimize and scale our marketing channels, building state-of-the-art decision support systems, predictive models and bidding algorithms. You will work across Customer Acquisition tribe supporting marketers and analysts in their scaling efforts and everyday campaign management decisions.

We are looking for a data expert with strong technical & statistical skills as well as a commercial mindset. It's a great opportunity for an ambitious & motivated analyst/scientist to transform their career in a fast growing & data-driven mature startup.

What you will be doing

Optimize and scale marketing channels using performance data
Build automated bidding algorithms
Build predictive models: customer (lifetime) value, competition, pricing, market behavior, attribution, segmentation etc.
Automate analytical processes around user acquisition
Communicate proactively and educate the rest of the company with your insights
What a day in the office might look like:

You start the day by checking up performance of the channel and results of the AB tests based on your new bidding algorithm to see if any actions are required. During the daily team stand-up you present your latest findings on the competitiveness of a certain market and share ideas to improve our value estimation algorithm. After a team lunch, you'll meet with other analysts to brainstorm new ideas and prioritizing the backlog. At the end of the day, you'll set aside time to research a more effective way to select our itineraries.

The team: marketers, analysts, data scientist and is supported by engineers.

Requirements
People we love:

You are highly analytical and data-driven and have the ability to assemble, analyse and interpret data to make decisions and communicate findings
You are curious, not afraid to make mistakes and willing to question the status quo
You have experience building models that produce commercial results
You have sound statistical knowledge (experience with Bayesian modeling techniques and probabilistic programming is a plus)
You love coding (preferably in Python) to make your ideas become real
Experience with bidding/trading algorithms is a plus
You are interested in and willing to learn about online marketing and travel (experience in related fields is a plus)
You are motivated and driven to take responsibility and succeed in a start-up environment
Why join now?

We recently rebuilt our website and its infrastructure to be faster, extensible, and scalable; built a local team of experienced product developers which will double during 2019; and are looking to grow traffic from 2.5M monthly visitors to 10M+ within the coming year.
Completing our mission means building an efficient tool users love. Doing that in a market as large and as competitive as online accommodation is a rare opportunity to make an impact in the online world.
We are a profitable company that aims to grow from 40 to 100 team members in the next year.
We have a strong user-acquisition engine and a lot of room to grow. It's an exciting journey in a company that's driven by data.

What we offer:

Lots of chances to learn and grow – you’ll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the city, be part of a culture which values sharing knowledge every day and has a budget to attend conferences and develop yourself.
A profitable company with fast growth and a great scale opportunity.
A competitive compensation package + perks and benefits (including Stock Appreciation Rights).
Flexible time off (take as many holidays as you need) and a chance to work remotely - we measure results, not time spent in the office.
You will be part of a highly international team in a fun work environment.
We value good food and offer catered lunches from various cuisines.

Desired Skills

  • Data Science

Contact Info

  • Company Website: https://www.findhotel.net/
Apply

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Would you like to work for a fast-growing startup with a great client portfolio and do it semi-remotely?

If so we need you to help us grow our content and social media strategy! We also have great opportunities for your growth. Join our international team of passionate people and do what you do best - create great content and grow our social media. An awesome opportunity awaits!

About us

At Kandidate we help outstanding candidates and top startups find a perfect match. As a result, speeding up the recruitment process and making it enjoyable. So far we helped 100+ European tech companies hire. Some of the big names are Zego, Decoded, Trussle, Algolia and more. On the other end, we have over 13,000+ candidates to match them with through our great product.

We are working together on a mission to make recruiting more fun and efficient since 2015. Currently, as a team of more than 20 people, based mainly in London and Poland, we are looking to expand our super fun and ambitious team.

Another great thing is that we are a two-sided marketplace, which means that you will be working not only on B2C but also B2B marketing, twice the fun!

Did we mention that we are currently the leading website in the UK for commercial hiring in the tech industry? So what makes us stand out? Top tech companies choose us over traditional recruitment agencies as we help them hire top candidates faster, at a more competitive price point and offer a better user experience. Tech professionals value the job matching accuracy, better user experience and transparency we offer.

And yes, we do go out for drinks and have off-site meetups, bring dogs to work and have a young and fun team!

Who are we looking for?

Now enough about us, let’s move onto you.

Currently, we are in need of passionate and driven Content and Community Lead to join our fun and fast growing team.

This is a London based opportunity, with semi-remote conditions, so yes, you can also work from home with your pet.

In this role, we are looking for someone who is comfortable working both, as a part of the team and independently. Being self-motivated and organised is crucial.

You will play a key role in the success of our marketing campaigns and will be responsible for creating our content and community strategies. You will be reporting to the Head of Marketing.

Key responsibilities

  • Plan and execute content and social media strategy and set goals to increase brand awareness and engagement
  • Create engaging text, image and video content
  • Develop, expand and participate in communities
  • Manage the work of content writers and agencies to make sure the projects are delivered in line with our standards.
  • Ensure the accuracy, quality and consistency of all content
  • Collect, monitor and analyze social and website metrics, and make improvements accordingly
  • Oversee all written content and ensure it is optimized for SEO, brand voice and the unique needs of different channels
  • Develop effective messaging for each of our audiences
  • Continually research and assess the competitive landscape, trends and customer needs to improve the effectiveness of content
  • Conduct customer interviews for content creation
  • Organise industry events (once per quarter)

Skills and qualifications

Required

  • 3+ years of content marketing experience
  • 1+ of managing social media channels
  • Proven work experience as a community manager
  • Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications or a related field
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent organisational and planning skills
  • Good analytical skills
  • Knowledge and understanding of algorithms and search engine optimisation
  • Comfortable with a dynamic and growing environment
  • Self-motivated, independent, organised and positive
  • A strong team player, comfortable working collaboratively and independently

Nice to have:

  • Preferred experience of organising events
  • Preferably experience of working in a SaaS/startup company and/or staffing & recruitment industry
  • An eye for design

Salary: ￡30,000 - 40,000 (depending on experience)

Target start date: 1.06.2019

Application process

Stage 1: After the CV review, we will invite you for an interview with our HoM and CPO

Stage 2: We will then invite you to work on a paid pilot project (10-20hr long). You will then present this project to our HoM, CPO and CEO.

Stage 3: Project presentation

items.content:
*About us*

Shortlisted for:

Nursery World Awards 2018 – Early Years Launch of the Year
Nursery Management Today Awards 2018 – Recruitment Initiative of the Year Business Development

We set out to redesign the nursery experience for families in the city – offering a fresh outlook on Early Years education, while also solving some of the key problems that most frustrate parents.
We opened our first site in Stoke Newington in 2017 and now we're building progressive and design-led nurseries across London – creating exciting settings for children and providing real value for families.

Stoke Newington received *Ofsted Outstanding* in April 2019.

Take a look for yourself www.nfamilyclub.com

*About the role*

At N, want to create an uplifting, one-of-a-kind experience for all our customers – both big and small.
We are looking for a smart & upbeat individual to join the team and be the face of customer service & front of house at Stoke Newington. Playing a crucial role in our front-line customer experience, the right candidate will balance operational nous with creativity & impeccable people skills - going that extra mile to delight our customers.

*What you’ll be doing*

* The face of the brand - developing great relationships with our parents & children
* Working with the nursery team delivering all of our day-to-day operational processes
* Line management of our Nursery Operations, managing rotas and organising everyone to deliver a great service
* Working with our nursery team to deliver timely communications to our parents including our weekly newsletter
* Procurement and budget management
* Collaborating with our events team and managing and running weekend Family Club events

*About you*

* A good degree or relevant work experience
* Good verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent computer skills including powerpoint/keynote
* Ability to multi-task effectively & prioritise
* Previous experience in an administrative or office management role
* Passionate and positive (always see the glass half full)
* Service-focused and detail-oriented
* Driven by a ‘make it happen’ attitude
* High energy brought to every task you take on
* A love for customer service (making people happy!)
* Hard worker and a problem solver

*Benefits*

We have a fantastic work environment that enthusiastically encourages creativity, growth and autonomy. Benefits include;

* Market leading salary (£17k- £22k depending on experience)
* 28 days holiday (including bank holidays) rising to 32 with length of service
* Your birthday off work
* Real career progression, lots of opportunities for development as we expand
* Round the world ticket and 2 weeks paid leave after five years
* Great team spirit, events and socials
* Free lunch, smoothie and barista made coffee each day

Please include a cover letter explaining why you're the best person for the role and why you are the best fit for N Family.

Please ensure your CV/profile includes your personal email address as this will be used to arrange phone screens for successful candidates.

Our safer recruitment procedures includes carrying out Enhanced DBS checks.

items.content:
About Oviva
We believe good health starts with nutrition and lifestyle, not medication. Our mission is to help 50 million
people lead healthier and happier lives by 2025 by providing the best diet and lifestyle therapy through
technology.


Oviva is a technology-enabled healthcare provider founded in 2014 seeking to offer the most accessible,
personalised, high-quality care possible to people with health conditions related to diet. Crucially, we embrace
technology to overcome the efficiency challenges facing the NHS.


We do this by:
* Creating unique, digitally-enabled treatment programmes for patients, delivered by dietitians
supported by a multi-disciplinary team of psychologists, psychological wellbeing practitioners,
specialist nurses, activity experts and health coaches.
* Offering patients access to expert advice in a time and place of their choosing, via our smartphone
app, online learning portal (with tailored video, audio and written learning content) or over the phone.


Our services are delivered in partnership with the NHS, supporting quality and efficiency improvements.
Today we provide NHS services in 57 Clinical Commissioning Groups and were recently selected for the NHS
England Digital Diabetes Prevention Programme and the NHS England Innovation Accelerator. Beyond the
UK we also operate in Switzerland, Germany, and France, and are backed by Europe’s leading venture funds.
We can only deliver all of this with the help of our incredible team. Having a culture that people want to work in
is very important to us and we’re proud to say 96% of our team would recommend working for Oviva.


We do this by keeping our values are at the forefront of everything we do, from patient care to internal culture:
* We put the patient first
* We measure and improve
* We tackle it together

The Role
We are looking for an experienced technical Data Analyst to join our Operations team, reporting to the Operations Lead. This role will be primarily focussed on our new Diabetes Prevention Programme contracts covering all reporting and analysis

This is a new role, working collaboratively with the DPP team, Clinical Teams and Reporting Team. You will be empowered to work autonomously, thinking big as well as having keen attention to detail, being a point of contact for all staff on everything data related!

Key Responsibilities
* Manage all DPP reporting including set up, monthly audits and reports, feedback to clinical team on patient activity and supporting the Finance Lead for invoicing
* Create and manage databases for data access for all staff
* Build dashboards for staff to manage patient activity
* Become the expert on what our patients do, what influences their pathway and how this effects their journey with Oviva from an insatiable curiosity and desire to deep dive into data
* Work closely with Oviva’s Reporting Team to innovate and improve processes and the way we think about data
• Data flow and pipeline creation
• Regular cleansing and maintenance of existing set ups
• Preparing various ad-hoc analytical reports or insights to aid senior management in decision making

The Ideal Candidate
• Innovative with great sense of initiative
• Obsessed with finding trends and connections with a passionate attention to detail
• A confident self-starter who will get their sleeves rolled up and hit the ground running
• Demonstrating flexibility and happy working in a fast-paced environment with remote teams
• Great teamwork skills and a strong communicator
• Prioritisation skills and buckets of enthusiasm
• Minimum 2 years experience in technical role
• Experience in database creation and management, SQL, Python required (JavaScript & R will be a bonus!)
• Experience in data visualization and cleansing
• 2:1 University degree in EEE, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science or similar related degree

Our Offer
• The opportunity to make a meaningful impact in revolutionising healthcare in the UK
• Exciting and rewarding role in high-growth start-up environment
• Training opportunities and regular salary reviews
• Flexible working
• £28-35k p.a. dependent on experience
• 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) with the option of an additional 5 days unpaid leave
• Company pension
• Regular team socials as well as free breakfast & snacks daily

items.title: Co-founder Business Lead at ARWAY - Equity Only
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
ABOUT COMPANY
(https://arway.app)

ARWAY is An indoor navigation platform that uses augmented reality (AR) and voice guidance, enabled by machine learning (AI) to connect, inform, guide users and ensure building safety.

Our vision is to better enhance the lives of everyone by making context aware AR solutions an accessible part of every day reality. Location awareness is critical to realising AR’s full potential and remains at the heart of the tools we develop.

The tragedy of Grenfell Tower fire in the summer of 2017 motivated ARWAY’s founder, Baran Korkmaz, to initially design a prototype app to guide people to fire exits and point out safety equipment.

In 2017, Baran’s early prototype ‘IMAREC’ won awards from the British Invention Show and The Big Bang Fair as well as gaining nationwide media coverage from Sky News, BBC, The Guardian.

Fast forward to 2019, we have completed 3 successful test-pilots including one of the worlds biggest hospitals. Supported by the IFE and NFCC in advising our user safety functionality in emergency situations. We are confident that we will disrupt the indoor location market by this year with our 2+ year R&D tech into making a scalable product.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for an exceptionally passionate, driven, creative and organised individual to lead as the 'Head of Business’ here at ARWAY. The central remit for the role is to define, design, develop and deliver our business to the next level. Equity will be attributed based on the Slicing pie model.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

We are looking for highly motivated individuals with an excellent attitude, ability to roll up their sleeves and hit the ground running, with the right skills, ambition, passion and personality to make a substantial impact on the future success of the business. All of the skills and experiences below are great to have but not all are essential.

-Experience in the AR/VR/MR industry
-Previous experience operating in a creative leadership, management or executive role
- Experience in hiring, managing and empowering top talent
- Understanding of budgets and business-planning
- Excellent communication skills
- Leadership and organisational abilities
- Strategic thinking
- Problem-solving aptitude

items.title: Food Process Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are a fast growing start-up committed to fostering an open and inclusive working environment whilst we develop novel products and have fun doing it. Join our team and help build the software, robotics and sensing systems to power the restaurants of the future.

You will join a team of engineers and designers focused on understanding the needs of kitchen and catering professionals as well as restaurant diners. You will be working in conjunction with our software, design and robotics teams to deliver market-ready solutions as part of a small and dynamic team.

Your role will be to work as part of this team developing novel develop machine architectures and food dispensing technologies.
You will be part of the team designing and developing the hardware and process engineering for Karakuri’s machines:

• Design of food dispensing technology, based on a variety of technologies.
• Physical design and oversight of manufacturing of the physical structure of our machines.
• Ensuring the safety of our machines
• Interfacing to the teams working on Karakuri’s wider software stack, especially working on machine vision and reinforcement learning.

Skills, experience, and qualifications:

• 3-5 years of industry experience designing and building food production machinery.
• Bachelor’s Degree in a technical area (or equivalent work experience).
• Experience putting in sourcing components and building manufacturing lines.
• Portfolio of experience in electro-mechanical design.

Essential skills & experience:

• Inventive and out-of-box thinker, strong interpersonal skills.
• Self-starter, and able to work effectively in a global, distributed team.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
• Proficiency in 3D CAD modelling, preferably SolidWorks, and programming software.
• Prototyping (using internal and external resources) and design validation.
• Creation and management of bills of materials to document proposed product changes.
• Experience designing for electrical component integration, able to specify motors, drives etc.
• Practical experience interfacing electrical system and panel building advantageous.
• Proven ability to manage third-party suppliers, ensuring design intentions are realised, manufacturable, and financially viable.

Desirable skills & experience:

• PLC and Motor controller programming
• CE and other safety certifications
• Experience with a wide variety of dispensing technologies: Linear Weighers, Conveyors, Piston Pumps, Peristaltic Pumps

Benefits

• Competitive Salary
• Stock Option Scheme
• Bonus Scheme
• Pension
• Health Insurance
• Life Insurance

items.title: Software Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=23, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
*About Util:*
Util is a London based Financial Technology company using machine learning to quantify the societal and environmental impact of companies and investors. Our vision is to see investment decisions being made to optimise positive financial, social and environmental returns. We are a team of 10, with a diverse range of experience, united by our desire to move mainstream investment towards companies that benefit society and the environment, in addition to achieving on or above market returns.

*Overview:*
As a Software Engineer at Util, you will focus on our software infrastructure and DevOps efforts. While you will have your own set of problems to solve, you should expect to work closely with the rest of the engineering team to ensure a tight cohesion between the different areas of the codebase. As such, we are looking for someone with a strong background in software engineering in Python who loves orchestrating code reviews, automating their workflow, and designing, implementing, and testing object-oriented code.

In addition to this primary engineering role, there are a host of secondary roles you can fill at Util. These mostly deal with large-scale cloud infrastructure on AWS, contributing to our data modeling, maintaining the data pipeline, implementing machine learning models at scale, and contributing to the NLP efforts that are crucial to our mission. We welcome expertise and enthusiasm in any of these fields.

As one of the first members of our growing team, we expect you to contribute to all aspects of Util, including strategy, company culture, and product development.

*Primary Responsibilities (expect to do all of these):*
* Implement robust software solutions to support our large-scale data processing requirements.
* Automate and maintain continuous integration and deployment processes.
* Rigorously review algorithms developed by our data scientists so that they are ready for production. These reviews are carried out via GitHub pull requests.

*Secondary Responsibilities (expect to do some, but not all, of these):*
* Contribute to the front-end efforts, which are written in JavaScript and utilize NoSQL databases.
* Contribute to the back-end efforts, which are written in Python and utilize SQL databases.
* Improve our MapReduce pipeline, which utilizes Spark, airflow, and other related software to scale our machine learning and efforts.
* Construct internal dashboards and metrics to monitor our data quality and track our progress.
* Implement machine learning models in scalable frameworks like Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, etc.

*REQUIREMENTS*

*Required Technical Skills:*
* Strong software engineering background, both in design and implementation.
* Evidenced experience building software projects, ideally with open-source contributions and projects on GitHub, GitLab, or any other software hosting site.
* Experience using Git in a team setting.
* Fluency in Python.
* Fluent in object-oriented programming, including familiarity with design patterns and best practices.
* Well established coding style.

*Desired Technical Skills:*
* Confident Linux user, especially with remote environments
* Experience processing, storing and accessing large datasets.
* Experience working with ML code.
* Fluency in a language other than Python.

*Personal Skills:*
* Ability to work individually and in a team.
* Flexibility and ability to adapt to changes in priority, with the understanding that process and structures are not rigid at an early stage startup
* Comfort with uncertainty - where others see unchartered territory you see the opportunity to innovate
* The desire to work in an idea meritocracy, where all ideas are welcomed and the only metric is quality.

*BENEFITS*
* Competitive salary
* Generous equity packages
* Flexible working policy (flexible hours + flexible work from home)
* Unlimited book purchases
* Half-day a week dedicated to personal development and learning including paid for online courses
* Central London office location
* Visa sponsorships

items.title: Internship - Signal Processing and Machine Learning Engineer (Great London - Walton-on-Thames)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=15, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=24, frontend=0}
items.content:
**What are we building?**

About 1.3% of the population stammers (or stutters), out of which 68% suffer from social anxiety disorder. That is 11 times more than the average population. This condition has distressing symptoms that deeply affect social and professional interactions and defines the life choices of those people who stammer (PWS). This social and professional challenge makes the fluency therapy business for PWS worth about $60bn/year worldwide.

Respira is the first wearable device that helps to master fluency habits, during everyday-life activities: it is like a coach and fitness tracker for PWS.

Respira mission is to break the communication barriers of young and adult PWS around the world by the use of machine learning and proven tested methods, irrespective of their location and financial situation. To achieve this, we are building a team of rockstar engineers to build, grow and scale a company which has the potential to improve the lives of 65mn people.

Based in London, Respira is lucky to have the support from InnovateUK, UK Universities and charities such as the British Stammering Association, AnxietyUK and the Stammer Trust.

**What are we looking for?**

We are looking for a bright person to fill in our internship position at Respira LTD. We have an urgent requirement to fill this position, but we would consider applications for positions available during the year.

You will work with the team of two founders, software developers and various freelancers. The position is a full-time job and may be remote or/and freelance/contract depending on the candidate attitude, experience and passion for the project.

**Responsibilities:**

- Process audio data to improve the algorithms that unambiguously detect speech habits that are incompatible with stammering. You will use your ingenuity to tune these algorithms to get the best performance of our system.

- Writing the firmware for different proof of concepts, writing the firmware for our final products and making sure that new updates are rolled out successfully.

- Support the product strategy from the CTO, and help to develop and update a comprehensive product roadmap (updated on weekly basis) by the use of appropriate PMO tools.

- You will be a creator that comes up with new ideas to improve the customer experience with our technology. Being one of the first to join the organization, your expertise will have a significant impact on the end product and the development process.

- Support experimental clinic tests to be run in universities with our system.

- Support a globally-distributed development team using Scrum, slack, GitHub, and Jira to support efficient, timely, collaborative development.

- Optional: you will be involved with the embedded hardware design.

**Requirements:**

- Scientist, Computer Science or another technical degree.

- Experience with common infrastructure and developer tools like Git, Linux, AWS/Google Cloud/Microsoft Azure.

- Able to build, maintain, and improve on production distributed systems for machine learning (e.g. Dask, PySpark, etc.).

- Big Bonus: Experience with DSP, preferably audio signal processing

- Big Bonus: Experience with wireless protocols.

**Bonus:**

- Embedded hardware experience.

- Experience working with C and/or C++.

- Either back-end development or mobile app (Android & iOS) experience.

- Statistical analytics, and data-driven management experience.

- AI/NLP experience building Chatbots.

**What’s in it for you:**

- The opportunity of learning the full-stack of hardware-software connected devices from hardware and firmware all the way up to data science and signal processing. The sky is the limit in terms of your opportunity for growth.

- Opportunity to lead s startup that has the potential to help 65mn people around the world.

items.title: AR Developer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=13, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=28, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
*ABOUT US*

Poplar (https://poplar.studio) is on a mission to democratise the creation of augmented reality content. Through our community of over 600 AR creators, our platform has enabled the production of amazing augmented reality experiences for major brands including Universal Music, Sony Music, Warner Music, Fox, L’Oréal, King, Wargaming, Disney and Speedo amongst others (see https://poplar.studio/showcase).

This is a great opportunity to join a small but ambitious team in a fast-moving industry with an experienced founding team, strong backing (Founders Factory, Haatch Ventures, Ascension Ventures) and an array of exciting clients.

We’re looking for an AR Developer to join our growing team based in Clerkenwell to help deliver client projects as well as contribute to the development of our platform.

Location: Clerkenwell, London, UK or remote
Role Type: Permanent or contract
Salary: £45,000 + bonus & equity

*RESPONSIBILITIES*

* Building prototypes of AR effects to pitch to prospective clients
* Assessing feasibility of different solutions to meet briefs
* Coordinating with creators to review work and provide feedback
* Developing in-house tools to enable our community of creators to build higher quality effects more quickly
* Running workshops and writing blogs to upskill and educate creators

*REQUIRED*

* Experience with Unity
* Experience with ARCore/ARKit
* Experience with Spark AR and Snap Lens Studio
* Experience with image tracking libraries such as Vuforia, EasyAR
* Experience with a variety of 3D modelling tools e.g. Blender, Maya, Cinema4D, 3ds Max etc.
* Experience with web AR tools e.g. AR.js, A-frame, 8th Wall, Jeeliz
* Solid understanding of UX/design patterns in augmented reality
* Ability to code e.g. JavaScript, C, C++
* Ability to wireframe/storyboard ideas
* Ability to use design packages such as Photoshop and Sketch
* Experience interacting with web APIs
* Strong understanding of cross-browser and cross-device testing
* Experience with version control software e.g. Git

*DESIRABLE*

* Experience with other AR tools such as Unreal Engine, Sumerian
* Experience working with 3rd party SDKs e.g. DeepAR, 8th Wall, Banuba
* Experience with AR platforms e.g. 8th Wall, Torch, 6D.ai
* Experience with computer vision e.g. OpenCV
* Experience working with and encoding 360 video/images
* Ability to build mobile apps
* Strong track record in social AR e.g. published multiple effects, achieved significant usage with them
* Experience with machine learning/AI
* Experience developing for headsets e.g. Magic Leap, Hololens
* Understanding of marketing/promotion techniques
* Understanding of web/software development
* Strong generalist/hacker spirit who plays around with emerging technologies

*WHAT WE OFFER*

* Flexible working hours - we care about getting the job done more than the exact hours you’re at your desk.
* Equity - we believe employees should share in the success of the business.
* Fun and supportive culture - we firmly believe in fostering a positive work environment, which means having fun as a team while challenging ourselves.
* Support for community projects - we believe volunteering and community activities shouldn’t come out of your 25 days’ holiday allowance.
* Inspiring surroundings - our office is filled with green life, but we also take the time to run offsites elsewhere in London (and beyond).
* Opportunity to learn rapidly - you’ll be working with experienced media tech pioneers in a fast-paced company and industry.
* Dog-friendly environment - just ask our office dog, Indiya (https://www.instagram.com/indiyathepuppy/).

We are committed to building a diverse culture and are eager to receive applications from all backgrounds. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.

items.title: Front end developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=26, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
We are looking for a Senior front end developer to lead our front end architecture.

We are working on a cutting edge technology in experimental deep learning for advanced formulations and require development of a clean dashboard and 3D data visualisations to enable user interactions with our core technology.|

WHAT DO WE DO? We are a Cambridge University spin out working with a new architecture for deep learning. Specifically we can handle sparse and noisy data and have customers in advanced materials and drug discovery with additional proof of concept projects in a number of other verticals. You will be employee number 5, we have paying customers, several research grants and opportunities for significant growth. Take a look at our website https://intellegens.ai for more information.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?* We’re looking for a front end developer who enjoys the challenge of creating a complex but intuitive interface for the end customer and would like to work with large multi-dimensional data. You should be able to prototype quickly, adapt swiftly to code challenges, be able to work as part of a team, have strong communication skills and be pragmatic in your approach. We are looking for someone who is either academically strong or familiar with Git, has a solid skill in modern javascsript framework such as ReactJS or Angular, and a strong appreciation of automated tests

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?* You will be working with our core team of computer scientists, customers and mathematicians to develop a clean, intuitive interface that will enable experimentalists understand their data and how the deep learning has derived new solutions. Most of your work will be front end web development, turning design mockups into a working web app by using existing template / UI kits. You would be leading the front end architect and may need to work on backend related problems from time to time. Note: If you can (and want to) do UX/UI design as well, please do let us know in the email.

WHY US?* We are working with cutting edge technologies, spanning machine learning, 3D modeling and data, using an innovative approach to create a user-focused product that everyone can use. We believe everyone in the team has the right to shape the direction of the company. You will be an integral part of our small team and you will make a real difference from day one.

BENEFITS* We offer a competitive salary, share options, pension scheme and 25 days paid holiday to get you fully rested. We will buy you any hardware you need and you can choose your preferred equipment. We have a creative and flexible work environment where you can do your best work. We are happy to consider some remote work for the right candidate.

Note: • All remote applicants and applicants from recruiter will be rejected. • You need to have the right to work in the UK. If you are not from UK or EU, please specify your visa status in your cover letter or else your application will be rejected

items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience. We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Spotify, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a few!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.

In three short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals. We have big plans and are now looking for a Data Operations Associate to join our Data Operations team and work collaboratively across the business. As a Data Operations Associate you will support seamless client onboarding and success with the Chattermill platform, help to prepare data for analysis, and investigate themes and sentiments behind customer experience.

*As a Data Operations Associate, you will:*

* Work with our Sales, Client Customer Success & Data Science teams to analyse data which allows our Artificial Intelligence to do its magic
* Work with client data that has been provided to us and flag any issues the data may present
* Be an important part in the process of onboarding clients by working behind the scenes to help get everything ready for when they first use Chattermill
* Gain exposure to the whole business and the ability to have a real say in how the business continues to grow
* Work with a network of freelancers who help on manual tasks and will enjoy communicating with them

*What we’re looking for:*

* 1+ years’ experience in a professional environment, ideally within operations
* Strong organisational skills
* Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
* Experience working with Microsoft Excel
* Excellent interpersonal skills and the love of working with others
* Manage multiple projects while prioritising high important tasks, setting and adhering to deadlines
* A collaborative worker and forward thinker with the ability to identify rising issues and communicate them effectively
* A passion for learning about different businesses and how their customers’ experiences can be improved
* Comfortability working with data to form arguments and answer questions
* A rapid learner with the ability to prioritise workload in a fast paced environment
* You’re a team player, you don’t draw the line under your own responsibilities - you care deeply about the whole success of the business

*Why join us?*

* A competitive salary and stock options
* Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!
* 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)
* Company pension plan matched at 3%
* A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns
* Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, gym memberships and more
* Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home
* Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace)
* Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga
* Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.title: Insight Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=12, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience. We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Spotify, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a few!) and are passionate about helping them put customers’ at the heart of their decision making.

In three short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals. Having recently closed a very successful VC round, we are in an exciting period of continued growth and development. We are now looking for an Insight Analyst to join us to further our clients’ ability to draw actionable insights from their customer feedback data.

The Insight Analyst will work closely with our major clients as well as our Sales and Customer Success teams to provide valuable interpretations of data to clients. This is an incredible opportunity to be at the forefront of solving business challenges to make real and positive impact on amazing companies and their customers globally.

*As an Insight Analyst, you will:*

* Work with our major clients to help them find insights in the Chattermill data to make changes to their business that will improve their customer experience. Many of our clients have millions of customers around the world so the scale of impact our insights have is enormous
* Become an expert in using the Chattermill platform and develop best practice for deriving valuable insights
* Work closely with the Customer Success team to deliver value to key clients using Chattermill
* Work with clients who may not be using the platform to the best of its ability to share valuable insights and increase their engagement
* Work closely with the Sales team to help win new business by showcasing our data analytics capabilities during trials to drive engagement with decision makers
* Collaborate with the Data Science team when necessary to dive deeper into the data to answer specific questions or business challenges a client may be facing
* Provide example insights and help to develop Case Studies for sales enablement

*What we’re looking for:*

* A strong track record of deriving actionable insights from complex data sets and communicating them to senior stakeholders
* You are naturally curious and driven to uncover information from data sets which may not be easy to ascertain
* The ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams, and to provide supplementary information for presentations to clients at times to short deadlines
* You have an impeccable attention to detail
* An excellent ability to distinguish which patterns and trends are important and will provide value to clients when data mining
* Strong internal communication skills and the ability to simplify and convey technical or complex concepts

*Nice to have:*

* Education to degree level within a STEM subject
* Experience of SQL, in particular its Postgres flavour
* Experience working with sentiment analysis or text analytics packages
* Experience with unstructured data
* Good working knowledge of Python and its data stack (NumPy, Pandas etc.)
* Understanding of statistical or Machine Learning techniques

*Why join us?*

* A competitive salary and stock options
* Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!
* 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)
* Company pension plan matched at 3%
* A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns
* Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, gym memberships and more
* Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home
* Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace)
* Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga
* Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience. We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Spotify, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a few!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.

In three short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals. We have big plans and are now looking for a Deep Learning Engineer to join our amazing Data Science team for our next phase of developing AI at Chattermill.

*As a Deep Learning Engineer, you will:*

* Work to deploy the latest in Deep Learning from research to models for commercial production
* Work collaboratively as part of an agile team while exchanging ideas and advice about both individual and team projects on a daily basis
* Explore ways to utilise and implement recent advances in Deep Learning to optimise and enhance the analysis that Chattermill provides
* Collaborate with the Engineering team to build out concepts from Data Science into fully fledged products and get them shipped in to the hands of our clients
* Iterate on improving existing and new products using feedback loops with clients enabled by the Sales and Customer Success teams
* Collaborate with the Data Operations team to train, iterate and deploy models which meet our high expectations for performance
* Introduce methods and internal products to enable other departments to utilise the power of Data Science in their own work
* Participate in sessions, for example in Breakfast and Learns, to help educate the wider company about AI and Machine Learning
* Participate in conferences, Meetups and events to present the work * Chattermill does and position us and yourself as a thought leader in the Data Science community

*What we’re looking for:*

* Strong Python experience (other languages are a bonus) with a passion for clean and maintainable code
* Previous experience working with Deep learning and knowledge of major data science libraries and tools
* Experience working with at least one of Tensorflow, Keras or PyTorch libraries
* Previous experience in NLP
* Experience building end-to-end machine learning projects, including research, building and optimising a model and delivering it as a working project
* Experience with SQL
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to simplify and convey technical or complex concepts
* The ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams
* Education to degree level within a STEM subject

*Nice to have:*

* Degree level education in Machine Learning or Data Science
* An excellent understanding of exploratory and statistical data analysis
* Experience with spaCy library

*Why join us?*

* A competitive salary and stock options
* Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!
* 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)
* Company pension plan matched at 3%
* A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns
* Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, gym memberships and more
* Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home
* Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace)
* Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga
* Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.content:
About us

Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.

We're currently working on some of the largest building projects in London (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf) and have grown from 5 to 35 people over the past year. We have ambitions to expand significantly, which means that we are looking for passionate and enthusiastic talent to join the team.

We move at a high speed, and will provide you with immense opportunities for initiative, creativity and leadership. Our proudly diverse, international team is based in London, Sarajevo and Yerevan, and has a wealth of experience from construction management to computer vision and robotics.



Your role

We are looking for versatile, creative engineers to join our team in London to work in collaboration with AI-research and Product teams. As part of your role, you will collaborate with our Computer Vision researchers and the wider Engineering team to design and implement our AI-software to solve real-world problems in the construction sector. You will also work with our Product and Architect teams to integrate back-end and front-end elements built by your team members into the application.

A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.

If you have a real passion for building high performance systems that are highly automated, scalable, manageable, and fault tolerant, then you will fit right in. We are looking for engineers with high levels of ownership. If you don't shy away from hard problems, and enjoy delivering value while furthering your technical vision, this position is for you.

This is an opportunity to join a highly talented team with proven traction early on in its journey, with competitive salary and equity compensation.

You will collaborate with the product, computer vision, and the rest of the engineering team in developing our cutting-edge AI solution
You will be involved in all phases of the service development lifecycle, based on an agile development methodology
You will lead a broad aspect of design, deployment, and SaaS operations
You will work in an environment where we foster and encourage innovation
You will take part in contributing to the end-to-end system architecture


Our culture

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

REQUIREMENTS
You should apply if you have:

A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field.
2+ years of hands-on software development experience
Experience of working in an autonomous team
You have strong communication skills - you can summarise the complex, liaise with your fellow Computer Vision engineers, and explain your work in simple terms to your other colleagues.
You're a problem solver and analytical thinker; you don’t accept the status quo and are always looking for creative solutions.
You have proven experience in translating project requirements to prototypes and robust software.

Technical requirements

Experience in high-performance and distributed applications, cloud software services
Strong skills in Node.js, Python and any modern C-based language, object-oriented development and design patterns
Basic knowledge of and experience with Computer Vision and Machine Learning, especially neural networks.

BENEFITS

Pro rata salary of £37,500 - £47,500 per annum plus generous option package
Friendly, open and transparent culture.
You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its scaling journey.
Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.
Regular mentoring and feedback.
Awesome start-up office in Central London, Fitzrovia
25 days' holiday plus all bank holidays.
Free coffee.
Regular socials and team retreats to exotic destinations (Tibilisi, Sarajevo,...Where next?)

The process

The interview process will involve:

A review of your application;
A 20-minute chat where we both can learn more about each other;
Homework assignment for us to get a sense of how you tackle problems;
Two rounds of on-site technical and cultural chats with the team. If you are not currently based in London, we would be happy to speak with you over video chat;
Final round to iron out any remaining questions you may have.
This process should take around two weeks, depending on diaries.

About us

Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.

We're currently working on some of the largest building projects in London (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf) and have grown from 5 to 33 people over the past year. We have ambitions to expand significantly, which means that we are looking for passionate and enthusiastic talent to join the team.

We move at a high speed, and will provide you with immense opportunities for initiative, creativity and leadership. Our proudly diverse, international team is based in London, Sarajevo and Yerevan, and has a wealth of experience from construction management to computer vision and robotics.

Your role

As part of your role, you will collaborate with our Computer Vision scientists and the wider Engineering team to both use and craft state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms to creatively solve real-world problems in the construction sector. You will be given lots of responsibility, driving projects which could involve implementing cutting edge algorithms and integrating these into our workflows and core software.

If you’re eager to apply Computer Vision and Machine Learning to real-world problems and would like to work with a world-class team of researchers and engineers, this role is a superb opportunity for you.

Our culture

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

REQUIREMENTS
You should apply if:

You have a MSc degree or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
You have hands on experience using machine learning and computer vision.
You have good coding skills in Python with experience using one of: Tensorflow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have experience in managing projects with large datasets
You have experience of working in an autonomous team
You have strong communication skills - you can summarise the complex, liaise with your fellow Computer Vision engineers, and explain your work in simple terms to your other colleagues.
You're a problem solver and analytical thinker; you don’t accept the status quo and are always looking for creative solutions.

BENEFITS

Pro rata salary of £50,000 - £65,000 per annum plus generous option package
Friendly, open and transparent culture.
You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its scaling journey.
Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.
Regular mentoring and feedback.
Awesome start-up office in Central London, Fitzrovia
25 days' holiday plus all bank holidays.
Free coffee.
Regular socials and team retreats to exotic destinations (Tibilisi, Sarajevo,...Where next?)


The process

The interview process will involve:

A review of your application;
A 20-minute chat where we both can learn more about each other;
Homework assignment for us to get a sense of how you tackle problems;
Two rounds of on-site technical and cultural chats with the team. If you are not currently based in London, we would be happy to speak with you over video chat;
Final round to iron out any remaining questions you may have.
This process should take around two weeks, depending on diaries.

Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

items.content:
Backend Engineer

Heetch

Read before applying:

We're a young company iterating over our remote culture so for now, we're only working with people in locations where the time zone is: -3 hours > Paris time zone < +3 hours

Marketplace Team @Heetch

Our team focuses on finding the right triggers to balance the demand (passenger requests) and offer (driver availabilities) to generate growth while maintaining a highly reliable service. It requires a lot of data work, in order to formulate hypotheses and create models which will fit the different cities we operate in. In other words, we try to build scalable and smart things to make mobility easier, for both drivers and passengers. Our team's goal is to make everything we can so anyone can Heetch anytime.

Tech Stack


* Golang

* Microservices

* Kafka

* Docker with Mesos & Marathon

* Unit and functional tests are as important as code




Does it sound like you?


* You're obsessed by the value you create for users, and not only with tiny little optimizations.

* You want to dive into Data science, algorithms and mathematics.

* You want to impact users and don't just want to push code.

* You care about reliability. Our users too :wink:.

* You like to try out many things and,...

* You are ok to drop some of them. And retry…

* You look for space to push ideas, bootstrapping is one of your hobbies.




What will you do?


* Develop and design real-time responsive solutions at large scales

* Define, evaluate and decide what are the solutions to integrate heavy computational algorithms

* Build solutions with Data scientists in a pod

* Chew on a lot of data to understand your problematics

* Analyze and understand user behaviours

* Bootstrap on emerging market




What are going to be your main challenges?


* Mentor our junior developers and help them to get better

* Improve the marketplace tech stack in our event-driven architecture

* Being able to successfully lead a 'multi-stack' project with both backend and data science

items.content:
Senior Data Engineer

PowerInbox

 verified

PowerInbox is looking for a Senior Data Engineer

*This job is fully remote (only in the USA, though) with the option to work from out NYC office*

If you join us, what will you do?

Build and maintain a real-time big data pipeline and reporting system for powerinbox. The data pipeline will feed our AI and analytics platform. The reporting system will automatically distribute reports to recipients on a configurable schedule. As needed, you will provide special reports as requested by sales and operations teams. This role offers opportunities to work with big data, data science, cloud computing, and the latest software technology.

Specific Goals


* Build and maintain a data pipeline for powerinbox machine learning.

* Assist with the development of a data warehouse on which reports are derived.

* Process 8 billion event transactions each month.

* Assure data is captured and stored without loss.

* Write code to provide reports for powerinbox.

* Write a system that will run reports on a configurable schedule.

* Increase revenue per 1,000 items by $0.10 each quarter.

* Respond to ad-hoc requests for information.




In order to be great at your job,

You Are

A fast learner; have great analytical skills; relentless and persistence in accomplishing goals; enthusiastic with an infectious personality.

You Work

Efficiently; with flexibility; proactively; with attention to detail; to high standards.

Together We

Emphasize honesty and integrity; require teamwork; have open communication; follow-through on commitments; stay calm under pressure.

You Have

Four to six years experience with Python or R; three or more years experience developing and deploying software on Linux; three or more years working with SQL; at least two years experience providing data analysis; professional experience with data science knowledge; and working knowledge of BI tools and software.

This is extra, but if you have it, it will make us happy


* Experience working remotely

* Knowledge of/interest in the digital and AdTech landscape

* Experience working with big data




About PowerInbox

Who We Are

We are a digital monetization startup ecosystem that is always open to new talent

 Why We Are

Personalization is key and we at PowerInbox believe that email is not meant to be stationary and static, but relevant and filled with dynamic content and advertisements.

What We Are

We at PowerInbox boost your revenue and brand engagement through real-time advertising, and native ad displays.

 If interested please send your resume to [email protected]

items.title: Senior Engineer Data Retrieval
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=12, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Engineer Data Retrieval

source{d

At source{d} we are building the technology stack for the next generation of Machine Learning powered developer tools. We are an open-core company built around our Open Source projects.

We have raised over ten million USD so far, and we are currently growing our team.

This is a remote position however can also be based from our Madrid office.

Responsibilities


* Writing robust and maintainable backend code.

* Designing new features.

* Maintain our projects and improve its stability.

* Supporting internal stakeholders.

* Supporting our open source community.




Requirements


* Strong backend coding skills in, at least, two languages.

* Good algorithmic problem-solving skills.

* Experience with performance optimization or scaling in volume of data.

* Strong Linux skills.

* Experience creating public APIs (REST, gRPC or equivalent).




Preferred Requirements


* Experience with Linux storage and networking.

* Experience with distributed systems.

* Experience with distributed storage.




Team

The Data Retrieval team is developing source{d}'s data retrieval pipelines that synchronize and provide access to any number of code repositories. Written mostly in Go, it aims to be robust, friendly, flexible and capable of running on large-scale distributed clusters over petabytes of data.

We at source{d} seek to be at the heart of any project related to source code. Thus, this core tool is used both in-house for building source{d}'s unique global scale open dataset of +60M code repositories for cutting-edge Machine Learning research, as well as used by our customers to ingest git repositories to their source code processing clusters.


* Good knowledge of Linux, storage, networking and distributed computing is important.

* You will be expected to have strong backend coding skills in at least two languages, and very good algorithmic problem-solving skills. Skill at programming in Go is not required but will be highly appreciated. We strongly believe it can be learned by any skilled developer, and we care much more about our team's mindset and prior experience than specific language skills.




Culture


* source{d} is a company for developers by developers. We firmly believe in always doing what's best for the individual developer in the community. Our team consists of members who are passionate about programming. To understand our culture better, read more about it here. 

* At the moment, we are 35+ people from 10 different countries working closely together from our office in Madrid. We are more than happy to sponsor you a visa and guide you and your family through the whole process if you decide to come to work from our office, but you may also choose to work remotely. Currently, we have remote team members in USA, Portugal, Ireland, France, Belgium, Poland, Estonia and Russia. 

* For those wanting to work from one of our offices, we fully support the visa and moving process for you and your family. 

* At source{d}, we have a transparent salary policy which we feel strongly about it. Your seniority level will be determined during the last round of on-site interviews. 

* At source{d} all of the projects we work on are public on GitHub and the vast majority are open-source under licenses such as Apache 2.0 or GPL3.

* We don't just believe in open-source, we also believe in radical transparency as an organization, there we publish everything about the company at github.com/src-d/guide.




Perks


* We go to conferences and other developer events!

* Open Source Days, every second Monday, you are encouraged to work on any OSS project you choose.

* Flexible hours, set your own schedule that fits you.

* Free books. We will buy any books that help you learn & grow.

* If you choose to work from one of our offices, you will enjoy a comfortable and spacious environment.

* Annual summer and winter Christmas parties and a hackathon retreat are held in Madrid and all team members are flown over for it.

* We also have our own, Open Source craft beers.




Other


* We offer visa and relocation support for those wanting to work in the Madrid office.

* The local timezone of developers who want to work remotely should be between San Francisco and Moscow.

items.content:
Front End Developer 

Entando

Our team is thrilled to announce that we are looking for passionate Front end javascript developers of all levels (junior, mid, and senior) to join the Entando Digital Experience Platform team. We will welcome fun, free-thinking, hard-working, passionate people that are willing to bring positive energy to our company, our culture and our challenges.

You will be joining a high caliber group of developers, designers and research specialists. A team entrusted with the research and development of the latest technologies, the coolest gadgets and most engaging UI's. A team that is committed to solving some of the biggest software challenges, tackle some of the most advanced concepts and who are willing to laugh, learn, love and enjoy the experience along the way.
You will be expected work in an agile (SCRUM) environment and collaborate with a distributed and multinational team (in the US, Italy, and beyond). This a fully remote development position. You'll have the opportunity to work on developing the next generation of Entando's platform and delivering on an entirely new technology stack.
If you are an enthusiastic, intelligent, technology driven, rigorous, team oriented, agile-ready, open source loving, coffee lover... we want to hear from you.

Benefits

Entando is a company that invests in their employees and in their happiness. Life at Entando can be challenging, but always FUN. We offer our people tremendous freedom with the space for open-thinking, group collaboration and true team-driven working dynamics. We offer a truly unique working environment with culture and benefits that no other companies in the region offer. Here at Entando...every employee has a voice...and we want to hear yours.
Here are some of our perks:
* Work remotely. Entando is committed to remote development
* Great work-life balance
* High caliber, high quality team
* Career development & planning
* Professional Development
* Values-driven organization
* Innovation sessions (where we welcome ALL employee ideas)
* High impact international projects
* and more...


Privacy information
Dear candidate, by answering to this job post and/or submitting your CV, your are authorizing us to process your data for potential selection and recruiting purposes only.
You can find more information about our privacy policy here: www.entando.com/page/en/privacy_policy.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=7, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=40, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Data Analyst (m/f/x)

komoot

 verified
**Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times—and we are consistently ranked amongst the highest-grossing apps in both Google Play and the App Store.

To help us better drive data-driven product decisions and strategy, we’re looking for a skilled and curious data analyst. We believe that data-driven decision making is key to our success and your skills, curiosity, and experience will play a crucial role in building the future of outdoor experiences.**

# Responsibilities
**What will you do**
* Turn events and data into actionable insights
* Develop analysis to drive product and business decisions and company strategy
* Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and continuous reports
* Communicate and discuss findings to different audiences (Co-founders, marketing, product, sales, etc.)
* Develop approaches to answer key questions with data analytics
* Consult and mentor our junior data analyst
* Organize and prioritize tasks of our data analytics roadmap
* Be an evangelist of data-driven decision-making

**Why you will love it**
* You’ll be a key player in making product development, marketing, and business decisions
* You’ll work closely with komoot’s co-founder and influence the future direction of komoot
* You’ll have the liberty to develop data analytics at komoot, technically and organizationally
* You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers
* You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want
* We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house or anywhere else that lies in any time zone situated between UTC-1 and UTC+3
* You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides

# Requirements
**You will be successful in this position if you**
* Have a burning desire to transform data into actionable insights
* Have 3+ years of experience in evaluating marketing campaigns, cohort analysis, A/B testing and retention
* Have strong and proven skills in SQL and Pandas
* Have strong communication skills
* Have Python and statistical skills
* Have a good overview of technical solutions in the data analytics field
* Have a hands-on attitude and are highly self-driven

**Sounds like you?**
Then send us the following:
* Your CV
* A write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in working at komoot
* Examples of your work (e.g. Dashboards, PDFs, Slideshare, etc.)
* Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account

items.content:
Data Engineer

CipherHealth

CipherHealth is an award-winning healthcare technology company with a suite of intuitive patient engagement solutions that streamline the responsibilities of hospital staff, increase patient involvement and satisfaction, and positively influence outcomes.

Our team is incredible and mission driven. We are an award-winning company that strives to do better every day. In addition to fun team activities, a company masseuse, and a ton of healthy snacks, we are driven by our work ethic, commitment to core values, and firm knowledge that we are helping people every day.

Job Responsibilities:


* Identifies deep-rooted, systemic issues within the stack and leads long-term initiatives to address them

* Has deep expertise across multiple domains

* Takes ownership of technical projects that have a strategic impact at CipherHealth

* Assists the technical lead on meeting goals related to long-term roadmap for major areas of the data engineering stack

* Introduces improvements that help the entire team become more productive and ship higher quality work

* Articulates the technical direction of the data engineering team

* Partners effectively with the technical lead and business stakeholders on strategic projects




Technical Responsibilities:


* Responsible for delivering technical solutions and capabilities on the platform to support our entire data platform

* Implement new, highly scalable platform components and tools and leveraging machine learning and deep learning models to solve healthcare problems

* Responsible for owning the data pipeline (ETL) from MongoDB to DWH

* Build features to support reporting and data science projects




Requirements:


* Master’s degree or equivalent experience

* 10 years of data engineering experience

* Experience with production grade applications




High proficiency with the following technologies:


* Programming Languages



* Ruby, R, SQL/noSQL, Bash, Javascript



* Technologies



* MongoDB , Pentaho PDI, Unix, Github



* Web Framework




We are also open to remote candidates outside of NYC.

procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for demonstrating Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.* Support the planning and implementation of data design services, building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.* T-SQL is required.* Knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL DW, and Azure SQL, Azure App Service is required.* PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates.* Experience with Git/TFS/VSTS is a requirement.Nice to Haves:* Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Stream Analytics.* Knowledge of Python.* Demonstrated experience preparing data and building data pipelines for AI Use Cases (text, voice, image, etc.…)* Designing and building Data Pipelines using streams of IOT data.
